title: Loyola Offers White Students “Safe Space” to Feel Guilty About Being White
text:
PHOTO: Gas Station Bans Patrons with Sagging Pants 
The club has a pretty extensive process for joining. Students wishing to join the white guilt club must first apply and then take part in six two-hour workshops on topics including “white privilege,”“safe spaces” and “cycles of oppression.” 
This club is only open to students who self-identify as white, the reason being that “(w)hite as a racial/ethnic category is difficult to define,” so in an effort to be politically correct the university club has offered “self-identify as White” as a loophole. 
“You may also identify as bi-racial and/or multi-racial, where you may come from a mixed-race, mixed-heritage family where some members identify as White,” the group stated on its web page . However, “If you identify as bi-racial and/or multi-racial, please know that the R.A.W. experience will focus primarily on the exploration of Whiteness.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Ten years ago, a story like this probably would only have been published as a satirical piece on The Onion. But sadly, this is the state of our nation now. White people need a space to feel safe to discuss how guilty they feel about being white. It seems that the more politically correct we get the more divided we become.
